title: Living.Door
body:
// have checks for unlocking it, assuming we have any here
<<if $is_epilogue is true>>
I don't think this door actually leads out, given how many times I remeber walking through it.
<<else>>
[[Living.Door_BruteForce]]
<<endif>>

title: Living.Enter
body:
<<stop MusicPlayer>>

Oh! This is my living room! I was in my own closet the whole time! Silly me!

...

<<if $is_epilogue is true>>
[[Living.Epilogue]]
<<endif>>

...

<<play MusicPlayer panic>>

OH MY GOD THIS ROOM IS ON FIRE!!!

<<if visited("Living.Tutorial_Ending") is false and $SkipIntro is false>>
MY WALLSCROLLS!!!

MY ANIME FIGURINES!!!

MY COMPUTER!!!!!!!!

I AM GOING TO BURN TO DEATH IN THREE MINUTES I GOTTA GET OUT OF HERE!!!

    // uncomment when choices work.
    [[Living.Tutorial]]
<<endif>>

I GOTTA DO SOMETHING, FAST!!!

<<start DeathTimer>>

title: Living.Tutorial
body:
<<start-tutorial DeathTimer>>

But this is my first time walking around the living room in a little bit, maybe I should recall my "tutorial" training...

-> <j>I DON'T HAVE TIME FOR THIS</j>
    I DON'T HAVE TIME FOR THIS!!! 
    I NEED TO MAKE TIME!
    HRRRRRRGGGGGGGGG!!!!!!!!!
    <<await add DeathTimer -10>>
    SHIT I GOT HOTTER, NOT COOLER
    HRRRRRRGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGG!!!!!!!!!
    <<await add DeathTimer 5>>
    GOOD ENOUGH
-> <j>THE FUNDAMENTALS ARE IMPORTANT</j>
    THAT'S RIGHT! WE NEED TO REVIEW!

First, I should remember how to get around here.
I believe if I were to imagine a "mouse cursor", and place that cursor at the end of my vision...
My perspective might "scroll" to include more scenery in that direction.
But what if I want to call attention to some object?
Hovering this "mouse cursor" over the item and "clicking" on the item ought to solve this.
Hmm, I think that's it for now!
Uh, what was I doing again?
...
...
...
...
...
...
...
...
...
OH RIGHT, GET OUT OF THIS ROOM!
LET'S GO!!!
<<await run-down DeathTimer>>
// run down timer to 1, pause at 1
Shit.

[[Living.Tutorial_Ending]]

// Give control for 5 seconds, then die. Tutorial ending.

title: Living.Tutorial_Ending
body:
<<await ending SceneManager Out_Of_Time>>

OH NO, I RAN OUT OF TIME I'M DYINGGGGGG
IF THERE WERE A <j>NEXT TIME</j> I WOULDN'T <j>REVIEW THE BASICS</j> AT ALL!!!

title: Living.Door_BruteForce
body:
// Gonna need to figure out how to define this initially, 
// or if undefined ints are just zero
<<if $door_count is null>>
    <<set $door_count to 0>>
    <<set $bang = "*BANG* *BANG* *BANG*">>
<<endif>>

<<set $door_count to $door_count + 1>>


<<if $door_count is 1>>
    What's up with this door? I can't open it!
    Is this the exit?
<<elseif $door_count is 2>>
    *bang* *bang*
    I don't think I can open it!
<<elseif $door_count is 3>>
    I mean, the wheel itself turns, but it's not doing anything!
<<elseif $door_count is 4>>
    Would staring at the door work? Could that unlock its mysteries?
<<elseif $door_count is 5>>
    PLEASE OPEN, DOOR! I'M BEGGING YOU!!!

<<elseif $door_count >= 25>>
    [[Ending.Brute_Force]]
<<elseif $door_count >= 6>>
    <<set $bang = $bang + " *BANG* *BANG* *BANG*">>
<j>$bang</j>
<<endif>>

title: Living.Olaf
body:
<<if $is_epilogue is true>>
[[Living.Olaf_Epilogue]]
<<endif>>


<<if $has_water_gun is false>>

There appears to be a poorly constructed snowman inside this refridgerator.

Olaf: Hello! I am Olaf the Snowman from the animated children's film <j>Walt Disney's Frozen</j>! I am a trademarked character loved by all children!
Olaf: I am especially loved by the children under 5. My core demographic.

Why are you in my refridgerator?

Olaf: <w>Disney Magic!</w>

You knocked all my food out to make room for your snow man body!

Olaf: Step off! <j>You're not a cop!</j>
Olaf: Have you seen <j>Walt Disney's Frozen</j>? Did you watch it to the end?

-> Yes
    Wonderful! Here's a gun!
    It shoot bullets made of ice.
    It is not very effective for killing or putting out fires.
    You could probably put out one fire with the bullets in the gun.
    <<set $has_water_gun to true>>
    (Got watergun!)
-> No
    Olaf: Let's watch it to the end! I have a portable film player inside of my snowy flesh!
    [[Ending.Frozen]]
-> Eat the snow man
    // This could tie into the brute force ending, making the puzzle getting enough time from eating frozen items.
    I eat the snow man.
    The snow man cried out "Don't eat me! I'm a living snow man!" 125 times, the length in seconds of his song titled "In Summer" from the film, Frozen.
    But that didn't stop me! All the frozen snowman flesh in my belly adds a whopping 60 seconds to the timer.
    <<await add DeathTimer 60>>
    <<pickup Olaf>>
<<else>>
Olaf: Enjoy your gun!
Olaf: I hope love it as much as children around the world love me, Olaf, the trademarked funny little snowman from the motion picture Frozen.
<<endif>>

title: Living.Computer
body:
<<if $is_epilogue is true>>
[[Living.Epilogue_Irrelevant]]
<<endif>>


<<if $computer_power is true>>
    [[Living.Computer_Use]]
<<endif>>


<<if $checked_computer is false>>

It's my computer desk! My computer appears to be powered off.

No problem for me, though!

<<endif>>

*click*

...

What the heck?!? It's not turning on!

<<set $checked_computer to 1>>

title: Living.Computer_Plug
body:
<<if $is_epilogue is true>>
[[Living.Epilogue_Irrelevant]]
<<endif>>

<<if $computer_power is 1>>
    The computer should be plugged in and ready to go.
<<elseif $checked_computer is true>>
    Aha! Oh course! The computer was not plugged in!
<<else>>
    My computer isn't plugged in. I should fix that.
<<endif>>

<<set $computer_power to 1>>
<<switch-sprite ComputerDesk>>
// Change sprite to plugged in

title: Living.Computer_Use
body:
Now, what do I do with what little time I have left?

-> Order a Pizza from Dominos
    [[Living.Pizza_Ending]]
-> Watch Bee Movie but x1000 speed
    [[Ending.Bee_Movie]]

title: Living.This_Is_Fine
body:
<<if $checked_finedog is true>>
    Dog: This is fine.
<<else>>
    A completely original dog is seated at the dining room table.
    His little hat is caught in the blaze.
    
    Dog: ...
    Dog: ...
    
    The dog clears his throat.
    
    Dog: This is fine.
    Dog: I'm okay with the events that are unfolding currently.
    The dog takes a sip of coffee. His arm singed by the blaze.
    Dog: That's okay, thinkgs are going to be okay.
    The dogs face starts to melt.
    
    Dog: ...
    
    Dog: Theft is not a joke.
    
    <<set $checked_finedog to true>>
<<endif>>

title: Living.This_Is_Not_Fine
body:
<<await ending SceneManager This_Is_Not_Fine>>

The competely original dog sits at the dining room table.
Dog: Th-
The dog clears his throat.
Dog: THIS IS NOT FINE!!!
Dog: OH MY GOD EVERYTHINGS ON FIRE
Dog: WHAT THE HELL IS MY PROBLEM???
Dog: OH MY GOD JESUS FUCK
Dog: WHAT THE FUCK WAS I EVEN THINKING?
The dog produces a fire extinguisher and begins putting out all the fires.
Dog: THERE WAS NO REASON TO LET IT LAST THIS LONG AND GET THIS BAD
Dog: THEY SHOT A GORILLA FOR GODSSAKE

...

The fires have been put out, and your livingroom is now a charred mess.

Please support KC Green's work. He is a national treasure.
// This is not fine ending

title: Living.FineDog
body:
<<if $is_epilogue is true>>
[[Living.Epilogue_FineDog]]
<<endif>>

<<if $seconds_remaining <= 45>>
    [[Living.This_Is_Not_Fine]]
<<else>>
    [[Living.This_Is_Fine]]
<<endif>>

title: Living.Pizza_Ending
body:
That's it! I can order a pizza from Dominos and tell them to call the fire department in the delivery instructions!!!
Let's just add a one-topping large pepperoni to the cart...
Enter my payment information...
And... submit! Here goes nothing!
// Show a pizza tracker graphic as it slowly makes the pizza
<<await play PizzaTracker>>
*knock knock*
They're here!
HEY! HEY! DID YOU BRING THE POLICE? I CAN'T OPEN THIS DOOR!
Delivery person: Uh, no
IT WAS IN THE DELIVERY INSTRUCTIONS!!!
Delivery Person: I didn't read those. Hold on.
// X out pizza tracker and draw in police tracker. It finishes at 0:01.
<<await play PoliceTracker>>

[[Ending.Pizza]]

title: Living.Time_Ran_Out
Living.HintBot
body:
<<if $is_epilogue is true>>
[[Living.Hintbot_Epilogue]]
<<endif>>


<<if $hintbot_uncovered is true>>
    [[Living.Hintbot_Uncovered]]
<<endif>>


<<if $examined_blanket_hintbot is false>>
There appears to be an object covered by a blanket in the corner.

Hintbot: I'LL GIVE YOU A HINT ABOUT THIS PUZZLE, MEATBAG. THERE IS ITEM UNDER FABRIC SHEET.

Huh? What was that?

<<create-fire ObjectSpawner>>

Looking at the sheet again, it looks like it has started to catch a blaze.

...

<<endif>>

Hintbot: OH NO I AM DYING PLEASE PUT OUT THE FIRE! THAT IS MY HINT!! BEEP BOOP.

<<if $has_water_gun is true>>
Use the water gun on Hintbot?
-> Shoot the gun
    I fired out all 12 shots at the blanket. Each bullet exploded into a small cloud of vapor on impact.
    <<remove-fire ObjectSpawner>>
    After shooting all the bullets, the fire died down enough to pull the blanket off of Hintbot without burning myself.
    // Remove blanket
    <<set $hintbot_uncovered to true>>
    <<pickup Hintbot-Tarp>>
    Hintbot: CORRECT. THE SOLUTION WAS USE WATER GUN ON BLANKET. GOOD JOB.
    [[Living.Hintbot_Uncovered]]
-> Save your bullets
    Nah...
    Hintbot: HOLY SHIT I CAN FEEL MY WIRES MELTING PLEASE STOP THIS FIRE
<<elseif $examined_blanket_hintbot is true>>
    Hintbot: HOLY SHIT I CAN FEEL MY WIRES MELTING PLEASE STOP THIS FIRE
    Hintbot: MAYBE THERE IS SOMETHING IN THE FOOD COOLING UNIT THAT COULD STOP COMBUSTION FROM OCCURRING
    Hintbot: THAT IS MY HINT
<<endif>>

<<set $examined_blanket_hintbot to true>>

title: Living.Hintbot_Uncovered
body:
<<if $got_hint is not 1>>
<<switch-sprite Hintbot>>

Hintbot: I AM HINTBOT, I SUPPLY TIPS AND TRICKS TO HELP YOU ON YOUR JOURNEY

How do I get out of here?

Hintbot: CALCULATING TO PHRASE AS HINT
Hintbot: PROCESSING
Hintbot: PROCESSING
Hintbot: REMOVE PAINTING FROM WALL AND EXIT THROUGH UNCOVERED WINDOW
Hintbot: ERROR. THE SOLUTION HAS BEEN OUTPUT INSTEAD OF A HINT
Hintbot: PROCESSING
Hintbot: DEBUGGING
<<endif>>
Hintbot: COLORFUL ITEM ON WALL CONTAINS SECRET
Hintbot: YOUR HINT HAS BEEN DEPLOYED. PLEASE FORGET ABOUT THE SOLUTION.

<<set $got_hint to 1>>

title: Living.Painting
body:
<<if $is_epilogue is true>>
[[Living.Painting_Epilogue]]
<<endif>>


<<if $got_hint is 1>>
    Remove the painting from the wall and exit through an uncovered window. Got it.
    HINTBOT: NO YOU HAVE TO REASON THROUGH IT PLEASE BEEP BOOP
    WHATEVER, WE'RE BURING OXYGEN HERE!!!
    // Remove painting
<<switch-sprite Painting>>
<<create-hole ObjectSpawner>>
    Uhhh... this isn't a window.
    This is a person shaped hole.
    Can I even fit in this thing?
    ...
    The hole is pitch black, and seems to go on forever is there an end to it?
    I feel like... this hole is calling to me.
    This is...
    -> Hintbot's hole  
        [[Ending.Hole_Hintbot]]
    -> My hole
        [[Ending.Hole_Mine]]
<<else>>
    Ah yes, my prized painting I display for everyone to see.
    ...
    TOO BAD IT'S GOING TO BE DAMAGED BY ALL THE FIRE AND SMOKE AFTER I BURN TO DEATH!!!
<<endif>>

title: Ending.Hole_Hintbot
body:
<<stop DeathTimer>>

COME ON HINT BOT, GET YOUR FAT ASS IN THERE AND CALL FOR HELP

Hintbot: KZZT- MAYBE THE BEST PATH IS THE PATH YOU BARELY FIT IN BEEP BOOP

This hole is creepy and I'm not touching it. For all I know it'll turn me into a beef jerky monster.

Hintbot: KZZZZZZZT- BEEF JERKY IS YOUR FATE IF YOU STAY IN FIRE. MORON. BEEP BOOP.

<<await ending SceneManager Rejection_Of_Vore>>

After attempting to cram Hintbot through the hole for what felt like $time_remaining minutes, he started making headway into the hole.
Suddenly a fissure appeared in the hole. Hintbot fell into it. 
The fissure immediately closed back up.

Hintbot: OH GOD. WHAT IS THIS FUCKED UP CREATURE. IS THAT A DOG MOUTH?
Hintbot: IS THIS SOME KIND OF WEIRD VORE THING? IS THIS SOME KIND OF VORE FETISH GAME?
Hintbot: I AM JUST A HUMBLE HINTBOT I DID NOT SIGN UP FOR ANY VORE FETISH GAMES!!!
Hintbot: SELF DESTRUCT ACTIVATED.

...
...

BOOOOOOOOM

Wow that explosion blew a huge hole in the wall!
Well, I guess I'll just leave now.
And ignore the wounded shreiking unfathomable monstrosity that tried to eat me.
And move to a different country.
Fuck this.

(RIP Hintbot)
// RIP HINTBOT ENDING

title: Ending.Hole_Mine
body:
<<await ending SceneManager Vore>>

This is MY hole!
I smashed my body against the hole several times.
I NEED TO LUBE UP!
I covered myself in oil, never losing eye contact with the hole.
Trying again, I managed to slide right in. The hole felt like it was sucking me deeper and deeper down.
I couldn't move my head or limbs, only slowly slide forward in pitch blackness.
I may not have burned to death, but I'm not sure if hole is a better fate...
But weirdly enough, I feel... content.
Safe.
...
...
...
Happy.
// HOLE ENDING

title: Living.Fridge
body:
<<if $is_epilogue is true>>
[[Living.Fridge_Epilogue]]
<<endif>>

MAYBE I CAN SURVIVE IN MY REFRIDGERATOR?

<<switch-sprite Fridge>>
<<disable Fridge>>

<<create-olaf ObjectSpawner>>

...

WHAT IS THAT???

title: Ending.Out_Of_Time
body:
<<await ending SceneManager Out_Of_Time>>

I fell on the ground, covered in fire.
This is the end for me.

title: Ending.Brute_Force
body: <> Oh. It's open! Easy peasy. Well, I guess I'll just walk out this door and leave now. ... OH WAIT ALL MY BELONGINGS ARE STILL BURNING TO DEATH SHIT!!! <> When the fire department arrived, my dwelling was a charred mess. They still sprayed the charcoal down with their hoses, though. My date today bailed on me. One way or another I'm making something wet tonight, he said as he sprayed the coals. So now my house is a puddle. Guess I'm sleeping outside for the time being. This time, I'm NOT in the dog house.

title: Ending.Continue
body:
Let's try that again.

<<await transition SceneManager>>

[[Living.Enter]]

title: Ending.Frozen
body:
<<await ending SceneManager Frozen>>

The little snow man in my refridgerator begins playing the full feature length film Frozen for my undivided attention. 
Olaf held me tight, keeping me cool enough to stay alive during the full runtime. 
We die in each other's arms die at the credits, having experienced one the greatest ever children's fairytale film.
BAD END...?

title: Ending.Pizza
body:
<<await ending SceneManager Pizza>>

Suddenly, the door was kicked open!
You made it officer, I'm saved!
Cop: Yeah, from hunger!
<j>HAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA!</j>
We all laughed in unison, in a way that felt completely normal and natural.
Not at all scripted, haha.

(Pizza End)
// go sepia, laugh track, roll credits, pizza ending

title: Ending.Bee_Movie
body:
<<await ending SceneManager Bee_Movie>>

Hehe, their voices are so high! They sound like bees!
And they're flying around the screen so fast, another common attribute of bees!
This is definately a good use of my last $time_remaining minutes alive.
...
And now it is over, and I am dying.

title: Living.Wallscroll
body:
<<if $is_epilogue is true>>
Anime still was a mistake.
<<else>>
IT WAS YOUR FAULT, <j>ANIME</j>
ALL OF LIFE'S HARDSHIPS ARE BECAUSE OF <j>ANIME</j>
<<endif>>

title: Living.Window
body:
<<if $is_epilogue is true>>
Is this a real window?
<<else>>
The window is... barred shut?
<j>WHO WOULD DO THIS???</j>
<<endif>>

title: Living.Oven
body:
<<if $is_epilogue is true>>
Not interesting.
<<else>>
DID I LEAVE THE STOVE ON??? IS THIS THE SOURCE OF THE FIRE???
Wait a second, this is an eletric stove...
HOW IS MY STOVE ON FIRE IT DOESN'T EVEN USE GAS!
<<endif>>

title: Living.Sink
body:
<<if $is_epilogue is true>>
Not interesting.
<<else>>
MAYBE I CAN USE SOME WATER TO PUT OUT THE FIRE
...
Oh yeah, my water is shut off. I didn't pay my bills.
Wah wah wah...
<<endif>>

title: Living.Epilogue
body:
<<play MusicPlayer relaxed>>

...huh?

This room is still on fire?

I thought I escaped.

Or did I die?

...

Was I eaten by a monster?

...

Maybe Hintbot can help.

<<start DeathTimer>>

title: Living.Olaf_Epilogue
body:
Olaf: Hello! I am Olaf the Snowma- 

I would like you water gun, please.

Olaf: ...

Give me the gun or I'll eat you.

Olaf: Hello! I am Olaf the Snowman from the animated children's fi-

YES, I HAVE SEEN FROZEN

Olaf: ...

Olaf: I'd be careful if I were you, dog.

<<set $has_water_gun to true>>

(Got watergun!)

<<pickup Olaf>>

Where did he go?

title: Living.Fridge_Epilogue
body:
<<switch-sprite Fridge>>
<<disable Fridge>>

<<create-olaf ObjectSpawner>>

...

title: Living.Epilogue_Irrelevant
body: I don't care about this.

title: Living.Epilogue_FineDog
body:
Why are you here?

Dog: I'd be careful if I were you, dog.

<<pickup ThisIsFine>>

title: Living.Painting_Epilogue
body:
Is this even my painting?
...
It's really ugly.
Not to mention the nightmarish hole behind it.

title: Living.Hintbot_Epilogue
body:
<<if $has_water_gun is false>>
[[Living.Hintbot_Epilogue_NoGun]]
<<endif>>

Didn't you die in an explosion?

Hintbot: WHAT?

<<create-fire ObjectSpawner>>

Hintbot: OH NO, I AM DYING IN THIS FIRE, I CANNOT ANSWER ANY MORE QUESTIONS.

...

<<remove-fire ObjectSpawner>>

How do I leave for real?

Hintbot: ...
Hintbot: UHHHHHHHHHH
Hintbot: HEARING SENSORS BROKEN
Hintbot: REPEAT YOUR QUESTION, PLEASE
Hintbot: ...

HOW DO I LEAVE FOR REAL?

Hintbot: ...
Hintbot: Maybe repeat it
Hintbot: 500 more times.

Is this to run down the timer?

Hintbot: I DO NOT KNOW WHAT YOU ARE TALKING ABOUT.
Hintbot: ALL I KNOW IS...
Hintbot: YOU SHOULD CONTINUE TO TALK TO ME FOR... $time_remaining MINUTES

<j>How many times have I died? How many times have you died?</j>

<<await add DeathTimer 10>>
Hintbot: PLEASE WAIT $time_remaining MINUTES!

WHO IS DOING THIS? WHY ARE THEY DOING THIS?
<<await add DeathTimer 30>>
Hintbot: $time_remaining MINUTES!?!?!?!?!?!?
Hintbot: !?!!?!?!?!?!?!?!?!?

HOW DO I MAKE IT STOP?
<<await add DeathTimer 60>>
Hintbot: !?!!?!?!?!?!?!?!?!??!!?!?!?!?!??!!?!?!?!?
Hintbot: SHUTTING DOWN.
<<stop DeathTimer>>

[[True_Ending]]

title: Living.Hintbot_Epilogue_NoGun
body: I need the water gun before bothering with him.

title: True_Ending
body:
...
Oh, of course.
The solution was right behind me.

<<await closet SceneManager>>

There was never a diversity mural here.
It has always been a normal window. A window with people on the other side.
Watching me.
Maybe I should jump right through and give them a visit.
<j>Then they can have something to panic about for a change.</j>
<j>Because I'll kill them all.</j>
<j>They've killed me so many times, it's only fair I pay them back.</j>

<<await ending SceneManager True_Ending>>

PLEASE EVACUATE THE FACILITY. A VIOLENT SUBJECT IS LOOSE.
50 WOUNDED.
10 CONFIRMED KILLED.

Margaret: *gasp* *gasp*
Margaret: I never thought something like this could happen.
Margaret: I knew there were researchers observing the effects of constant panic on animals, but to think they went to such extremes...
Margaret: Once the subject learned how to open a fridge, use a computer, even talk to living snowmen... I thought they'd end the test.
Margaret: But I suppose the sky's the limit, right?
Margaret: ... *gasp*
Margaret: I just hope my wound doesn't worsen before help arrives.
Margaret: ... *gasp* *gasp*
Margaret: I'd hate to leave my husband alone...
Margaret: ... much like how a female Northern Saw-Whet Owl leaves her mate and young before they're ready to leave the nest, causing them to live in filth until they're able to move on with their lives.
Margaret: not that we have *gasp* children or anything...
Margaret: *gasp* *gasp* *gasp*

...

Well, I finally escaped the room, which was on fire!
I sure am glad I was able to have a happy ending!
I think the real moral of the story, though, is that animal experimentation is probably always morally wrong, I bet.
Even if it helps treatment of degrenerative diseases like diabetes.
And also I did nothing wrong.
Fin.

title: Ending.Continue_Into_Epilogue
body:
...

<<await transition SceneManager>>

[[Living.Enter]]
